Legal_Issue: Whether the Board's decision rejecting the Applicants' refugee claim based on credibility was reasonable
Application_Facts: Applicants claimed refugee status due to fear of reprisals from family members in Nigeria
Decision_Outcome: Board rejected the Applicants' refugee claim based on lack of credibility
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of reprisals from family members in Nigeria
Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, subsection 72(1)
Credibility_Assessment: Board identified numerous contradictions and provided detailed reasons for rejecting explanations
Evidence_Used: Testimony and evidence related to family-based threats in Nigeria
Legal_Provision_Cited: Subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Basis: Refugee protection due to fear of harm in country of origin
Evidence_Assessed: Explanations provided by Applicants, presence of contradictions
Relief_Sought: Overturning of the Board's negative credibility determination
Governing_Rule: Presumption that all evidence was considered unless proven otherwise
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of credible evidence supporting claims; inconsistencies in testimony
Outcome: Dismissal of judicial review application; Board's decision upheld
Harm_Assessment: Alleged risk of reprisals from family members in Nigeria
Cause_Description: Applicants claimed refugee status due to fear of reprisals from family members in Nigeria but were denied due to lack of credibility
Evidence_Handling: Board considered evidence and found key explanations not credible
Evidence_Assessment: Detailed evaluation of credibility and consistency of claims
Decision_Rationale: Decision fell within a range of defensible outcomes based on facts and law
